comments:
Build used: eclipse 3.1 RC1 + cdt 3.0 build after M7

Found this when I played with macros/enviroment in magaged make project 
properties page. Steps to reproduce:

- select a mgd project, go properties->C/C++ build->Environment or Macros page
- Check "Show parent level variables"
- place the cursor on edge of the dialog and resize the dialog
- IDE stops response at this point, have to kill IDE

Tried again on eclipse 3.1 RC3, same thing. Easier way to reproduce is to go 
to Macros page, and resize the dialog.

Attached error log, changed Component to UI. Also added Leo to CC list.

Hi James,

I will try to find the problem. The main issue for now is that I can not 
reproduce the bug on my machine (I have Windows XP) neither for RC1 nor for 
RC3, and that no MBS code is involved in the fail. I have tried to use both the 
I200506200301 cdt sdk build and the cdt sources from HEAD, and the property 
page resizing worked fine for me.
From the stack trace it looks like the fail occurs because the Table.items 
array size is smaller than the actual OS table size. Im not sure whether this 
is an MBS or an SWT bug.
It would be really helpfull if you could provide me with some more info 
regarding the fail.

Thank you,
Mikhail

(In reply to comment #2)
> Hi James,
> I will try to find the problem. The main issue for now is that I can not

the

It could be my previous installation somehow screwed up. I just reinstalled 
eclipse rc3 and cdt latest build. Works fine now. 

Thank Mikhail for your reply.

James

Hi James,

I suppose that the bug you reported was not invalid. I have encountered the 
same problem today working with eclipse 3.1RC3 both for cdt-M7 and the latest 
sources from cvs HEAD). Note that the same versions of eclipse and CDT worked 
fine for me yesterday. I'm not sure whether or not we should reopen the bug, 
because I've already implemented and checked in the fix for it. If you have a 
chance either to get the latest CVS sources or the next CDT build, please let 
me know in case there is something wrong with UI for you.
The real source of the problem remains unclear for me. I noticed that the bug 
was initiated because the OS.SendMessage (handle, OS.LVM_GETITEMCOUNT, 0, 0); 
call made in the Table.WM_PAINT handler that was called while resizing, return 
a zero item count for that table that really contained a lot of elements. I 
suppose this might be caused either by the bug in SWT or by the incorrect table 
resize handling in the TableLayoutComposite that is used as a parent for the 
parent control created in the ListDialogField, and that is actually handling 
table resizing.
In any case, I have switched to using the TableViewer directly instead of using 
the ListDialogField, and everything seems to work fine for me now.
When I have time, I will probably investigate the issue with using the 
ListDialogField.

Thank you for reporting the problem
Mikhail

Hi Mikhail,

I will be testing RC1 this morning and keep an eye on this issue. 

Thanks,
James
